cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi (115 km) SSE of Port Aransas, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northward today, then turning north-northeast tonight and Tuesday, tracking parallel to the Texas coast toward the upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast between Port O’Connor and San Luis Pass (near/just west of Matagorda Bay)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas to San Luis Pass, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Sabine Pass, TX (T.S.); Port Aransas, TX to Sabine Pass including Galveston Bay (Storm Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay and extending into southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt with higher gusts) likely Monday night into Tuesday; a brief period of near-hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible in and around Galveston Bay, including the Texas City Ship Channel.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated 20 inch totals possible, producing life-threatening flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday night–Tuesday; dangerous surf and rip currents.
